alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 7:52AM CDT until May 16 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding along the Lavaca River reaches hundreds of yards into the lower floodplain backing up sloughs and low areas. Minor roads and near the river flood and livestock are isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM CDT Friday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.8 feet Sunday morning. It will then rise above flood stage late Sunday evening to 22.6 feet early Monday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.3 feet on 03/11/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Lavaca River Edna 21.0 23.2 Fri 7 am CDT 20.8 15.8 22.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM CDT.
